public class GenericPieceTest
extends java.lang.Object

Ensures that the GenericPiece works correctly.

Author:
Sebastian Paaske Tørholm

squaresFromStrings

testValidSquares

public void testValidSquares()
We have some important things to test to see if validSquares() works: - That it doesn't returns squares past the edges - That it ignores squares pieces of the same color are on - That it doesn't ignore squares with pieces of a different color on them For this purpose we have 3 different pieces we will check. edgePiece, which is next to an edge and a piece of a different color edgePiece2, which is next to an edge and a piece of its own color nonEdgePiece, which isn't next to any edge, but next to a piece of a different color

testCanMoveTo

public void testCanMoveTo()
We use the same test cases as we did in the validSquares test. We know from the test above that validSquares works, so we use that in this.

testMoveTo

public void testMoveTo()
We need to make sure that moveTo: - Updates location() - Updates the board

setUpPawns

private void setUpPawns()
Setting up pawns for our tests. We will test whether it allows correct movement of pawns: - That it allows you to move 2 spaces in the beginning - that it only allows you to move 1 space forward when not in the beginning - that it allows you to move to capture other pieces - that it doesn't allow you to move to capture other pieces in front of you

testInitialPawnState

public void testInitialPawnState()
Ensure the correct starting state of our pawns.

testPawnCannotCaptureStraight
